meanings.definition: Stronger or more muscular in appearance or physique.
meanings.sent1: The wrestler looked brawlier than his opponent.
meanings.sent2: He became brawlier after months of weightlifting.
meanings.sent3: The brawlier dog tried to fit into the tiny bed, causing much laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was brawlier than the strongest storm.
meanings.sent5: The brawlier oak tree stood tall against the wind.

meanings.definition: More aggressive or confrontational in behavior.
meanings.sent1: The brawlier dog growled at anyone who came near.
meanings.sent2: She became brawlier when defending her beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The brawlier cat hissed at its own reflection, thinking it was a rival.
meanings.sent4: His temper was brawlier than a raging bull.
meanings.sent5: The brawlier lion roared to assert dominance.

meanings.definition: In a more robust or vigorous manner.
meanings.sent1: He ran brawlier than ever before in the race.
meanings.sent2: The team worked brawlier to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The chef stirred the soup brawlier than a whirlwind.
meanings.sent4: The music played brawlier as the crowd cheered.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed brawlier after the heavy rain.
